description: Origin uncertain. Shaka is not a word in the Hawaiian language, which lacks the /ʃ/ sound.

entries.meaning: A greeting gesture in which the thumb and little finger are extended while curling the three middle fingers in a semi-fist. Used to express a variety of positive meanings including "all right", "hello" and "goodbye".
examples: US President-elect Obama flashes the 'shaka' before he greets a crowd  […]
